DOC.brief_summary: Female pelvic floor disorder ( PFDs ) include urinary incontinence , pelvic organ prolapse ( POP ) , fecal incontinence—which often occur together . Pelvic floor disorder impair multiple aspect life quality , include sexual function woman . Surgery become first choice treatment , however , 1980s renew interest conservative therapy . This may high awareness among woman cost morbidity surgery . The conservative treatment include pelvic floor muscle training , electrical stimulation , vaginal cone , biofeedback . The outcome 35~70 % improved rate literature . Current guideline recommend conservative management first-line therapy . However , consistent consensus issue due variation stimulation parameters、adjuvant concurrent modality duration treatment course , insufficient result large long term follow randomized- control study . Therefore , investigator try conduct one randomized-controlled trial evaluate efficacy conservative treatment Pelvic floor disorder ( Pelvic organ prolapse , urinary incontinence , chronic pelvic pain etc. ) . At aspect Quality life , study try focus different domain pelvic disorder sexual quality mean validate questionnaire objectively .
DOC.brief_title: A Randomized Controlled Trial Electrical Stimulation Treat Pelvic Floor Disorder
DOC.criteria: Patients suffer pelvic organ prolapse and/or urinary incontinence and/or fecal incontinence . Patient pregnant The patient major medical psychiatric disease The patient Metabolic medical device
